description: System-generated primary key for the status record.
Business identifier for the status, typically the label shown to users; confirm if it serves as a unique code.
Human-readable description of the status shown in interfaces and reports.
Flag indicating the default status within its category when creating or transitioning orders; confirm behavior.
Workflow category code grouping related statuses; confirm category definitions with SME.
If true, order details (header and lines) are locked from editing while in this status.
If true, receiving-related fields are locked from editing while in this status.
Indicates whether quantities in this status contribute to on‑order inventory for planning and availability.
If true, the entire purchase order is read-only in this status.
Requires entering a reason or authorization code when applying this status; confirm exact requirement.
Prompts the user if unreceived or open items remain when moving into this status.
Prompts the user to enter completion details when selecting this status.
Prompts the user to enter cancellation details when selecting this status.
Default notes associated with this status, optionally displayed or printed; often mirrors the status description.
System timestamp of the most recent update to this status record.
Enforces approver spending limits before allowing transition to this status.
Allows printing the purchase order while in this status.
If true, the status field itself cannot be changed while in this state.
Timestamp of the last modification performed by a user; column name suggests a user identifier—confirm intended value.
Allows negative receipts or returns on miscellaneous items when the order is in this status.
Identifier of the user who created this row.
Date and time this row was created by a user.
Identifier of the user who last modified this row.
Date and time this row was last modified by a user.
